title: Freedom of Information Act Request: Direct Energy Weapons (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents which pertain to direct energy weapons (DEW) being tested or used on this United States Citizen, Amy Catherine Matelic, LCSW.
For all current ongoing CIA, FBI, DOD office of the Secretary of Defense and DOD OIG, US Army Intelligence and Security Command, U.S Navy, AIr Force or Marines and U.S. Special Operations Command, Directed Energy Bio-Behavioral Research (DEBR) programs and contracts in the United States of America as of March 7, 2023 using directed energy weapons (DEWS), Non-lethal Weapons (NLW's), neurological weapons such as Remote Neural Monitoring weapons/technologies, or any other kind of Electronic Warfare or Combat Systems Testing/Training involving the use of (non-ionizing or ionizing) radiation weaponry or radiation techniques of any kind whatsoever on "Human subjects" such as myself either knowingly or unknowingly, Amy Catherine Matelic, LCSW, being conducted by any sector or joint operation of the CIA, FBI or DOD whether Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Special Command or any other, whether to determine the "human effects" or "bioeffects" of such radiation, as "scientific research" for purposes of calibration of radiation (possibly termed non lethal radiation) intended for the use on human subjects for interrogation techniques, "behavior control," "behavior modification,"  or for any other purpose to be used on Amy C. Matelic, LCSW  please provide:
1. The Statement of Work/Scope on each program or full contract with each contract awardee or winning offeror company, and the full statement of work included with each contract;
2. Completed documentation of Informed Consent from all human subjects, which may or may not include Amy C. Matelic, LCSW, targeted by this program or contracts Bio-Behavioral Research or Weapons Testing and Training Program which includes:
a. The FWA (Federal Wide Assurance) signed off by the Office of Human Research Protections, Department of Health and Human Services;
b. Detailed informed consent documents listing consent of human subjects, (which may or may not include Amy C. Matelic) specific information provided to human subjects, and signed documents from human subjects attesting to informed consent;
c. Any additional internal CIA document assuring compliance with the Common Rule-signed off by the Institutional Review Board involved;
d. All affirmations of Compliance Oversight from the Office of Human Subject Research Protections; & 
e. All waivers of consent from the Secretary of Defense, if and as applicable, and full reasons of these waivers.
3)Completed documentation with precise details on location and Field of Operations where these DIrected- Energy Weapons are being trained "wittingly" or "unwittingly" overtly or covertly on human subjects--namely, American Civilians such as Amy C. Matelic and others in the USA. All documents mentioning individuals exposed such as Amy C. Matelic , to directed-energy weapons by FBI, CIA, DOD, or any other governmental entity as listed above.
4) The frequencies (Hz) used in each DEW.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Amy Catherine Matelic

title: FOIL: Schenectady City School District and Common Thread Consulting, LLC _ to present

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL: Schenectady City School District and Common Thread Consulting, LLC _ to present
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all cash receipts, invoices, and work product produced by Common Thread Consulting, LLC, a limited liability company owned by Schenectady City Councilman Damonni Farley, for services provided to the Schenectady City School District from July 1, 2021 to the date this request is fulfilled. This includes but is not limited to:

Invoices or billing statements submitted by Common Thread Consulting, LLC to the Schenectady City School District.
Cash receipts showing payment by the Schenectady City School District to Common Thread Consulting, LLC.
Work product produced by Common Thread Consulting, LLC for the Schenectady City School District, including any reports, presentations, or other documents.
Any communications between Schenectady City School District employees and Common Thread Consulting, LLC regarding the services provided by the company.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: FOIL Request for Written Explanations for Waivers of 72 Hours Notice

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Written Explanations for Waivers of 72 Hours Notice
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a copy of any and all written explanations provided by Capital Region BOCES regarding emergency situations that necessitated a waiver of 72 hours notice. Specifically, I am requesting the written explanation of the emergency situation and the reason why waiting for the full 72-hour notice period would be impractical or detrimental to the public interest. A list of meeting dates where 72 hour notice was waived is listed below.

Please note that Advisory Opinion 13126 states that public bodies are required to document the emergency situation and the need to hold a meeting or provide documents with less than 72 hours notice. Therefore, I am requesting copies of any such documentation, including any notes, memos, or other records related to the emergency situations and the decisions to hold a meeting with less than 72 hours notice.


Here is a list of the meeting dates for which I am requesting written explanations:

Thank you for your attention to this matter. If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact me.

New York State Open Meetings Law, specifically section 104(4)(b) which states that "In the event of an emergency requiring immediate action, a public body may conduct a meeting without notice as long as it publicly states the reason or reasons why such meeting was not practicable to notice as provided in subdivision one of this section."

Additionally, the New York State Committee on Open Government has issued several advisory opinions that emphasize the importance of documenting the emergency situation and the need for the meeting. For example, Advisory Opinion 13126 states that "In order to establish that there was an emergency that warranted dispensing with the 72-hour notice requirement, a written explanation of the emergency should be prepared."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: FOIL: Procedures for handling removal of school officers by NYSED Commissioner

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL: Procedures for handling removal of school officers by NYSED Commissioner
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All materials related to processes that would need to take place if the Commissioner of Education of the State of New York removes one, multiple or all board members, school officers or superintendents from a school district under the jurisdiction of Sole Supervisory District of Albany-Schoharie-Schenectady-Saratoga Counties and BOCES or CR BOCES. Specifically, I request any and all materials including, but not limited to:

1) Policies, procedures, and protocols for responding to the removal of board members, school officers or superintendents, including but not limited to filling vacancies and ensuring continuity of school district operations.

2) Records of any past instances where the Commissioner of Education has removed board members, school officers or superintendents from school districts under the jurisdiction of Sole Supervisory District of Albany-Schoharie-Schenectady-Saratoga Counties and BOCES or CR BOCES and the actions taken by the Sole Supervisory District of Albany-Schoharie-Schenectady-Saratoga Counties and BOCES or NYSED in response.

3) Any other records or materials relevant to the processes that would need to take place if the Commissioner of Education removes one, multiple or all board members, school officers or superintendents from a school district under the jurisdiction of Sole Supervisory District of Albany-Schoharie-Schenectady-Saratoga Counties and BOCES or CR BOCES.

Please provide any records or materials that are responsive to this request, regardless of format or medium. If some records are not subject to disclosure, please provide the reasons for the denial of access.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: FOIL: Schenectady City School District and Common Thread Consulting, LLC

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL: Schenectady City School District and Common Thread Consulting, LLC
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all cash receipts, invoices, and work product produced by Common Thread Consulting, LLC, a limited liability company owned by Schenectady City Councilman Damonni Farley, for services provided to the Schenectady City School District from January 1, 2015 to July 1, 2021. This includes but is not limited to:

Invoices or billing statements submitted by Common Thread Consulting, LLC to the Schenectady City School District.
Cash receipts showing payment by the Schenectady City School District to Common Thread Consulting, LLC.
Work product produced by Common Thread Consulting, LLC for the Schenectady City School District, including any reports, presentations, or other documents.
Any communications between Schenectady City School District employees and Common Thread Consulting, LLC regarding the services provided by the company.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Hauppauge Union Free School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Hauppauge Union Free School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking all records related to the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and the Council on School Health (COSH), including any communications or correspondence between the school district and these organizations, or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

To help identify responsive records, you can limit your time period to 1/1/2017 until the date of final response; also I request that you search for the following terms, which are focused on the American Academy of Pediatrics and its affiliated organizations:

"American Academy of Pediatrics"
"AAP"
"Council on School Health"
"COSH"
"pediatric"
"child health"
"school health"

Please include records of any type, including but not limited to emails, letters, memoranda, reports, meeting minutes, presentations, and any other records of communication or correspondence between the American Academy of Pediatrics, the Council on School Health, and the school district or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

If no records are responsive to this request, please provide a certification of that fact pursuant to Public Officers Law §89(3), and inform me of the district's obligations under LGS-01 to retain records until any appeal has been resolved.

If any records are withheld, please provide an explanation of the legal basis for the withholding.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a written explanation of the reasons for the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker
